overview_of_class: Data analysis in the modern age requires familiarity of many concepts and methods from statistics. This course provides an introduction to the basics as well as exposure to some of the most advanced techniques. The emphasis will be on practical problems from physics and astronomy, rather than on theory or on statistical methods from other fields. Prior knowledge of statistics is not required.
name: Statistical Methods for Physicists and Astronomers
title: WCAS PHYSICS 441-0-1 Statistical Methods for Physicists and Astronomers

instructors.instructor_addr: Technological Institute (2145 Sheridan Road), Room F-113, Evanston

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Data analysis in the modern age requires familiarity of many concepts and methods from statistics. This course provides an introduction to the basics as well as exposure to some of the most advanced techniques. The emphasis will be on practical problems from physics and astronomy, rather than on theory or on statistical methods from other fields. Prior knowledge of statistics is not required.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Undergraduate students should obtain the permission of the instructor.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will understand basic concepts in frequentist and Bayesian statistics. Students will know the most common probability density functions. Students will understand what hypothesis testing is and how to frame such tests. Students will be able to evaluate effective statistics, for example, from maximum likelihood methods. Students will be able to complete a linear and also nonlinear regression.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Assigned homework problems, one in-class midterm exam, and one final research project (written).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
There are two required textbooks.

1. G. Cowan, Statistical Data Analysis, Oxford Science Publications, 1998
ISBN-13: 978-0198501558

2. Z. Ivezic et al., Statistics, Data Mining and Machine Learning in Astronomy, Princeton University Press, 2014
ISBN-13: 978-0691151687

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
One additional textbook is optional.

1. F. James, Statistical Methods in Experimental Physics, 2nd edition, World Scientific Press, 2006
ISBN-13: 978-9812705273

Lecture notes will also be available online.
